1.text: Brethren, truly my heartâ€™s delight and prayer to God for Israel is for salvation.

2.text: For I testify for them that they have a zeal of God, but not according to knowledge.

3.text: For not knowing the justice of God, and seeking to establish their own justice, they have not been subjected to the justice of God.

4.text: For Christ the end of the law for justice to every one believing.

5.text: For Moses writes the justice of the law, That the man having done these things shall live in them.

6.text: And the justice of faith says thus, Thou shouldest not say in thy heart, Who shall go up to heaven? (that is, to bring Christ down:)

7.text: Or, Who shall go down to the abyss? (that is, to bring up Christ from the dead.)

8.text: But what does it say? The word is near thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we proclaim;

9.text: For if thou confess in thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and believe in thy heart that God raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.

10.text: For with the heart is believed for justice: and with the mouth is confessed for salvation.

11.text: For the writing says, Every one believing upon him shall not be ashamed.

12.text: For no distinction is of the Jew and also of the Greek: for the same Lord of all being rich to all calling upon him.

13.text: For every one whoever should call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.

14.text: How then shall they call upon whom they believed not? and how shall they believe whom they heard not? and how shall they hear without him proclaiming?

15.text: And how shall they proclaim, except they be sent? as has been written, How beautiful the feet of them announcing good news, peace, of them announcing good things!

16.text: But not all listened to the good news. For Esaias says, Lord, who believed our report?

17.text: Therefore faith, from the report, and report by the word of God.

18.text: But I say, Have they not heard? Surely, in all the earth went out their sound, and their words to the end of the habitable globe.

19.text: But I say, Did not Israel know? First Moses says, I will make you jealous of not a nation, and by a shortsighted nation will I anger you.

20.text: And Esaias is very confident, and says, I was found of them not seeking me; I was manifested to them not asking for me.

21.text: And to Israel he says, The whole day have I unfolded my hands to an unbelieving and contradicting people.
